definition: evenly matched (idiom)
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals
equal/even/all/uniform
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: “The two invaders appear to be equally matched.”, ” Moffett says.
sentences.chinese: 这两帮侵略者看来势均力敌。
那是一场势均力敌的比赛。

sentences.english: And that head-to-head race ends on Election Day when the voters cast their ballots.
sentences.chinese: 而这场势均力敌的竞赛将在总统大选日结束。

sentences.english: But the old man had raised his hand up to dead even again.
sentences.chinese: 但老人又把手扳回来，恢复势均力敌的局面。

sentences.english: The well-matched tennis players fought a long, close battle.
sentences.chinese: 两名棋逢对手的网球选手打了一场势均力敌的长仗。

sentences.english: Evenly matched opponents every game will produce the United States.
sentences.chinese: 势均力敌，赛逢对手才会产生美。

sentences.english: The defensive team nearly equipoised the offensive team.
sentences.chinese: 守队与攻队几乎是势均力敌。

sentences.english: The two football teams are level-pegging at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 两个足球队此时势均力敌。

definition: lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
to be evenly matched/to meet one's match
both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
at a stalemate/deadlocked/in unrelenting mutual opposition
neither giving way to the other
see 棋逢對手|棋逢对手[qi2 feng2 dui4 shou3]
to both share the limelight/to both have an equal share of
not to know one's place
to be deadlocked
wrestling/a trial of strength
to take the lead/to gain the upper hand
lit. unable to distinguish eldest brother from second brother (idiom); they are all equally excellent/nothing to choose between them
(sports) draw/tie
both sides (in contract)/the two opposing sides (in a dispute)
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill
